name: Scanner, desktop, E1025, E1035, S2040, S2050, S2060w, S2070, S2080w
description:
This unit process represents the gate-to-gate production of one Kodak Alaris scanner models E1025, E1035, S2040, S2050, S2060w, S2070, and S2080w (mass = 3.72 kg).  The system boundary includes: 1) the transport of raw materials to multiple manufacturing facilities where various subcomponents are produced; 2) the manufacture of subcomponents; 3) the transport of subcomponents to a different manufacturing plant for final assembly; 4) the assembly of subcomponents into a complete scanner; and 5) the transport of generated waste from the manufacturing facilities to a municipal solid waste landfill.  The following processes and life cycle phases fall outside of the system boundary: 1) packaging of the completed scanner; 2) all transport downstream of the assembly plant gate; 3) sale of product; 4) product use phase; and 5) end-of-life phase (including recycling).

The use of this unit process for the analysis of similar devices requires professional judgement based on the degree of similarity.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Primary data is valid from 2017 - 2019.  Secondary data is valid from 2005 - 2019
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The manufacture of a desktop scanner that uses 2016 technology including information storage and processing and energy savings features.  The manufacture includes the manufacturing of subcomponents at other facilities and assembly at a central location.
processDocumentation.dataCollectionDescription: All primary data were collected from 2018 to 2019.  Secondary data were collected from 2005-2019 (National Renewable Energy Laboratory 2016; Wernet et al. 2016).
processDocumentation.completenessDescription:
TREATMENT OF MISSING Environmental Data - all known elementary flows are included, so cutoff is <1%
Technosphere flow data - Intermediate flows are cut-off at less than 1% (physical criteria).  Capital equipment used for manufacturing are not included.

MASS BALANCE - The mass of inputs (not including fuels) balances with the scanner output, so there is less than 1% difference.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: An attempt was made to include data for all inputs.  Primary data was used where available and the most representative secondary data was used where primary data was not available.
processDocumentation.reviewDetails: The Wood (2019) methodology is almost identical to the methodology described in Wood (2012) which is an ISO 14044 compliant, peer-reviewed LCA report of three Kodak scanners (Kodak i2800; i2600; and i2400), which was peer reviewed by Kate Wennebeck of Rochester Institute of Technology's Pollution Prevention Institute.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Primary data were taken from precise engineering specifications specific to this unit process.  These data were then transformed into material and energy flows using the methodology described in Wood (2019) which is due to be released in August, 2019.  The Wood (2019) methodology is almost identical to the methodology described in Wood (2012) which is an ISO 14044 compliant, peer-reviewed life cycle assessment report of three Kodak scanners (Kodak i2800; i2600; and i2400).

Secondary data were taken from the ecoinvent 3.2 database (Wernet et al. 2016) and the U.S. Life Cycle Inventory Database (National Renewable Energy Laboratory 2016).  The data were global except where otherwise specified.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription:
Allocation rules: Materials were based on actual specifications.  Energy and fuels were allocated to products manufactured at the location based on their mass.
Substitution allocation: Substitution by close proxy ( data for similar processes were used for the components)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
BOUNDARY CONDITIONS
The system boundary includes: 1) the transport of raw materials to multiple manufacturing facilities where various subcomponents are produced; 2) the manufacture of subcomponents; 3) the transport of subcomponents to a different manufacturing plant for final assembly; 4) the assembly of subcomponents into a complete scanner; and 5) the transport of generated waste from the manufacturing facilities to a municipal solid waste landfill.  The following processes and life cycle phases fall outside of the system boundary: 1) packaging of the completed scanner; 2) all transport downstream of the assembly plant gate; 3) sale of product; 4) product use phase; and 5) end-of-life phase (including recycling).

DATA COLLECTION
For material inputs, data collection was based on scanner specifications provided by the manufacturer.  Other inputs (e.g. energy; waste transport and disposal) were calculated on the basis of quantity of input per kg of scanner produced.

UNCERTAINTY ESTIMATION
Uncertainty was estimated based on engineering judgment.  Material inputs had less uncertainty because they were based off of precise engineering specifications.  Other inputs  (e.g. energy; waste transport and disposal) had more uncertainty.

Summary is available to public.

processDocumentation.intendedApplication: The intended application for this unit process is for "Accounting" purposes as described in Situation C2 from the Institute for Environment and Sustainablility (2011:3).   As such, it describes the gate-to-gate production of one E or one S series desktop scanner "without being interested in any potential consequences on other parts of the economy" (Institute for Environment and Sustainablility 2011:3) and without consideration of potential benefits from recycling the scanner at the end of its useful life.
processDocumentation.projectDescription:
Data and LCA results are reported in Wood (2019) Life Cycle Greenhouse Gas Assessment Summary Report -
Kodak Alaris models E1025, E1035, S2040, S2050, S2060w, S2070, S2080w Scanners - ISO 14044 Protocol
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Scanners are manufactured in China, but components represent a global supply chain and secondary data is based on best available data from global sources.

publication.name: Wood R (2012) LC GHG Summary Report Kodak i2800, i2600, i2400 Scanners

sources.name: Wernet et al. (2016) The ecoinvent database version 3 (part I): overview and methodology.

exchanges.description: 3.72 kg desktop E and S series scanners
